title: Turning off backupGlobals
body:
I'm currently porting over some tests to use Codeception since we're about to start adding Acceptance tests. However, the current codebase include a lot of leftovers from PHP4 days, meaning there's liberal use of global etc.

Is it possible to turn off the use of backupGlobals?

title: fillField fails occasionally
attachFile seems to fail in Functional test
body:
Hello,

here is a piece of my functional test in a Yii2 project which gives an error:
```php
$I->attachFile('//form//input[@type="file"]', 'picture.jpg');
```
The error is UPLOAD_ERR_NO_FILE.

It seems that `\Codeception\Lib\InnerBrowser::attachFile($field, $filename)` passes the correct value in `$formField->upload($path);`, but `\Symfony\Component\DomCrawler\Field\FileFormField::setValue($value)` gets `NULL` in `$value`.

I use `Yii2`, advanced app template and latest version of `yiisoft/yii2-codeception` extension.

title: [LogicException] The page history is empty.
body:
I am preparing acceptance tests for my SOAP API methods. I've already made two of them and if I launch each of them separately, they pass without any problems. But if I call them together using `codecept run acceptance`, second always fails with `[LogicException] The page history is empty` on `$I->see();` method. Why is it so?
I'm using codeception v2.0.11

title: Asserts module greater/less than documentation is opposite of functionality
Local acceptance tests show 0% coverage
body:
Hi, I'm working with codeception to test a Joomla! extension I'm developing. I've written a simple acceptance test (which was incredibly easy to do) and am running it locally with phpbrowser, and I've confirmed it's working as expected. However, I'm having issues where the code coverage report is showing that no code is being touched by the acceptance test. 

In codeception.yml I have this:

```
coverage:
    enabled: true
    include:
        - testapp/index.php
```

I'm including index.php in the coverage because it should always be executed for every request. I've included c3.php in index.php and I know it's being loaded. When I run `codecept run acceptance --coverage-html`, the report gets generated, but it looks like this:

![b0747277691f221b1a1616ea7e606657](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5873529/6200957/7a138dee-b456-11e4-84d9-2a606a17167c.png)

I've confirmed xdebug is installed and remote_enabled is on. I've also tried setting the `remote: true` config option, but that generates the same result. Nothing obvious shows in apache logs (my site is running the traditional LAMP stack). Any ideas? It would be great to have a combined report of all code coverage between unit and acceptance tests. Thanks!

title: Firefox profile: works for individual test, fails when running suite
body:
I have a Firefox profile that I want to be activated whenever Codeception runs acceptance tests:

```YAML
# app/tests/acceptance.suite.yml

class_name: WebGuy
modules:
  enabled: [WebDriver, Db]
  config:
    WebDriver:
      url: 'http://localhost'
      browser: firefox
      window_size: 1200x950
      capabilities:
        firefox_profile: 'app/tests/_data/browsers/firefox/profile.zip.b64'
      curl:
        CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER: true
```

This works fine when I run a single test, like `codecept run acceptance someCept`. But if I run the whole suite with `codecept run acceptance`, then the browser is loaded using my default Firefox profile instead.

I am using this custom profile to trigger an "acceptance" environment in Laravel, by checking for a cookie. So when I say, "the profile is not loaded", I don't technically know this. What I do know is that the correct environment is not triggered.

title: @before and @after annotations break _before and _after hooks
sendAjaxRequest is not using the url specified in the PhpBrowser module config.
body:
I'm using `$I->sendPOST($entityUrl)` from the REST module, which results in a request to  `[Request] GET /entity`. `$I->sendAjaxRequest('DELETE', $entityUrl)` results in a request to `[Request] DELETE http://127.0.0.1:8888/entity`. But this is not correct, since the webroot is in a subfolder, specified in the PhpBrowser config.

I'm not sure what is causing this.

title: fillField not working for IE11 but working for chrome, firefox, safari
GrabFromDatabase - no data
fillField and implicit wait
body:
I'm using codeception 2.0.11

If I set implicit wait to e.g. 10 seconds (using the wait config option of webdriver), and then use `$I->fillField('input[name="TestForm[name]"]', 'Test');`, codeception will do two xpath finds that wait 10 seconds each.
I cannot change implicit wait from the test (well, maybe with getModule, but I haven't figured that out and in any case I can't change it back to the original value). This makes it pretty much useless, and I have to put waitFor* everywhere.

title: Move codeception.yml to tests/ dir
body: Hi, I would like to move the main config file codeception.yml into tests/ folder. I've changed paths.* in main config file. So, if I want to run all tests ``` php vendor/bin/codecept run --debug --config="tests/codeception.yml" ``` it's ok, but if I want to run only one tests ``` php vendor/bin/codecept run --debug --config="tests/codeception.yml" tests/acceptance.suite.yml tests/acceptance/SignInCept.php ``` it doesn't work, ends with Suite acceptance.suite.yml was not loaded. Where I do a mistake? Thanks

title: get browser name
body: how can i get browser name ?

title: Cest dependencies fail because test result uses wrong class name
body:
Looking at TestResult https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/master/src/Framework/TestResult.php#L348

The class name is added to tests passed, but this prevents referencing tests in this format:
 * @depends Admin\Bundle\Tests\APageLoaderCest::tryStudentRegister
because the actual class being checked is \Codeception\TestCase\Cest::

The best solution I could find is the search for the correct test based on test name, and ignore the class name except to tell codeception that it isn't in the same class that is currently running.


I retract my previous statement.  Something else is causing me to not be able to run my tests.  Following the stack a little closer I see it is replacing the correct names.

Looks like it is replacing the passed tests with the name of the current testing class instead of the class that the test was executed in.

title: can't get haveHttpHeader() send Authorization header
body:
This seems quite odd, I'm trying to authenticate using Http Basic Auth on my REST interface build with Yii2 but I keep receiving an "invalid credentials" error.
Replicating the test in Postman seems to be working without issues, so I'll exclude a problem on Yii side.

I have the following test:
```php
$I->amGoingTo('authenticate to search for my own user');
$I->haveHttpHeader(
    'Authorization',
    'Basic ' . base64_encode($user['username'] . ':' . $userPassword)
);
$I->sendGET('users/search/'.$user['username']);
$I->seeResponseCodeIs(200);
```

by running it I get:

```
../vendor/bin/codecept run functional UserAPICept.php --debug
Codeception PHP Testing Framework v2.0.10
Powered by PHPUnit 4.4.5 by Sebastian Bergmann.

Functional Tests (1) -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Modules: Filesystem, Yii2, REST, FixtureHelper
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Test the user REST API (UserAPICept) 
Scenario:
* I get fixture "user"
* I am going to authenticate to search for my own user
* I have http header "Authorization","Basic dXNlcjpzb21ldGhpbmc="
* I send get "users/search/user"

  [Request] GET http://basic-dev.yii2.sandbox/v1/users/search/user
 ERROR 

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Time: 6.06 seconds, Memory: 16.25Mb

There was 1 error:

---------
1) Failed to test the user rest api in UserAPICept (/mnt/workspace/yii2-book/tests/codeception/functional/UserAPICept.php)
Couldn't send get "users/search/user":
yii\web\UnauthorizedHttpException: You are requesting with an invalid credential.

Scenario Steps:
4. I send get "users/search/user"
3. I have http header "Authorization","Basic dXNlcjpzb21ldGhpbmc="
2. I am going to authenticate to search for my own user
1. I get fixture "user"

                                                                                      
  [yii\web\UnauthorizedHttpException] You are requesting with an invalid credential.  
                                                                                      
#1  /mnt/workspace/yii2-book/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/filters/auth/AuthMethod.php:56
#2  /mnt/workspace/yii2-book/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/ActionFilter.php:71
#3  yii\base\ActionFilter->beforeFilter
#4  /mnt/workspace/yii2-book/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Component.php:538
#5  /mnt/workspace/yii2-book/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Controller.php:259
#6  /mnt/workspace/yii2-book/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/web/Controller.php:108
#7  /mnt/workspace/yii2-book/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Controller.php:149
#8  /mnt/workspace/yii2-book/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Module.php:455
#9  /mnt/workspace/yii2-book/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/web/Application.php:83
#10 /mnt/workspace/yii2-book/vendor/symfony/browser-kit/Symfony/Component/BrowserKit/Client.php:327
                                   
FAILURES!                          
Tests: 1, Assertions: 0, Errors: 1.
```

I'm currently using CodeCeption 2.0.10 (updated just moments ago).

title: Grabbing page source
body:
Hi

Is there a way to grab the HTML page source at any given time?

I have a fancybox popup that will display various radio buttons depending on others that are checked.

As it is in the fancybox, making a screenshot only displays the current view in the popup. The radio buttons are further down and thus hidden.

What I want to do is grab the page source to check which radios are present. 

The reason for this is, even when I use `seeElementInDom('#radio_element')` when i then call `checkOption('#radio_element')` always fails

title: Getting shebang line in responses while using c3
body:
Hi.
I'm getting weird error - as soon as coverage is enabled and c3 is imported in my index.php, i start receiving simple shebang line(`#!/usr/bin/env php`) as a response. I also see shebang line on any Codeception command ran (with or without coverage enabled), for example `codecept build` will result in shebang output, while Symfony's built-in `codecept list` won't.
I've tried to backtrace it, but got stuck in commands.

Used versions: Codeception - 2.1.x-dev, c3 - 2.0.3 (dev-master couldn't install itself).

title: PhantomJS and Sessions
body:
I'm using PhantomJS to test a form I have.

The form uses sessions to manage the stages.

If I run the test the forst time, the form is filled out fine. When each section is filled out, it is then made read-only.

The next time I run the test, the session seems to be kept and therefore the tests, which looks for fields to fill, fails.

I have the following in my `functional.suite.yml`:

    config:
        WebDriver:
            url: 'http://my.url.tld
            browser: 'phantomjs'
            port: 4445
            wait: 0
            restart: true
            clear_cookies: true
            capabilities:
              phantomjs.page.settings.userAgent: "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.2; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/32.0.1667.0 Safari/537.36"
              unexpectedAlertBehaviour: 'accept'

I have the `clear_cookies` set, but I'm unsure if there are any other configurations i need to have

title: Problem with run command with specified suite or tests with one runner
body:
I followed information on this page to have seperate tests for each bundle: http://codeception.com/docs/08-Customization

Unfortunately **run** command doesn't support this configuration, because
command **run unit** still runs all tests in all suites.
I have to specify configuration in bundle to get this to work.

title: REST.php $I->haveHttpHeader not working as expected
body:
I noticed that I can not set the Host header using:
```
$I->haveHttpHeader("Host", "www.expected.com")
```
When I do that, I see in my Apache log files that I'm getting the DNS name I used to make the request instead of the value I used e.g. "www.expected.com"
***However*** If I do the following:
```
$I->haveHttpHeader(" Host", "www.expected.com")
```
I can see the value of "www.expected.com" in my Apache logs. 

Is this a bug or a feature? Is this how I need to set header variables?

I'm using codeceptino 2.0.9 and php 5.5.10

title: No easy way to switch between database connections
body:
When working with multiple databases, it seems not possible to switch between database connections (DSNs).

A typical use case would be in situations where you have two databases which are differently tuned; for the kind of data they deal with. One for configuration lookup, i.e high performance, almost all coming from memory, and the other database server for huge tables, say for example logs or financial transaction history.

If one needs to write a test that would talk to multiple databases, it would be handy to be able to switch between DSNs at will during the test.

title: Codeception:Message
body:
After run test project by this command  php codecept.phar run api  LoginCest.php --steps I get the following output:

* am trying  to login.........
* I have http header "Content-Type","application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
* I send post "?",{"operation":"login","username":"xyz@abc.com","accessKey":"xyz"}
* I grab data from json response 
* see test status:Passed.

But I get only this output:

 * am trying  to login.........
 * see test status:Passed.

body:
Hello,

I am trying to count on a functionnal test the number of rows in a table.

I have found that seeNumberOfElements would be perfect for that.

The problem is that when i use it the command exit without any error.

I don't see if the test has passed or fail, and all the code below this line is not executed.

```php
$I->wantTo('to view the list of manifest');
$I->haveManifests(5);
$I->seeNumberOfElements('tr', 5);
````
`````
$ vendor/bin/codecept run functional ManifestListCept -vvv

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Trying to to view the list of manifest (ManifestListCept)
Scenario:

$
`````

Do you have an idea ?

title: HTML Report lacks information
body:
I feel like the HTML report could be more useful, I'd like to see it including:

1. Screenshots of failed tests
2. Test names & file names being clickable (to launch a code-editor)
3. Filters at the top to hide successful tests

I'm happy to attempt to implement these changes, any advice or other thoughts are welcome.

title: Suite run order depends on a YML files creation order
body:
See https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/6634#issuecomment-67984017 and https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/6634#issuecomment-67985811
Maybe the suite run order should follow a YML file names order, shouldn't it?

title: Cannot create helper that uses Symfony's Filesystem module
body:
Hi again.

Strangely, but `2.1.x-dev` version skips tester build if one of the helpers contains `use Symfony\Component\Filesystem\Filesystem;` statement. here is the most basic example possible:

```php
namespace Codeception\Module;

use Symfony\Component\Filesystem\Filesystem;

class ImageHelper extends \Codeception\Module
{
}
```

unit.suite.yml:
```yml
class_name: UnitTester
modules:
    enabled: [Asserts, UnitHelper, ImageHelper]
```

As soon as i remove Filesystem statement, everything gets back to normal.

title: Add feature to remove code coverage output from console
body: Would be great to have ability to remove code coverage dump from console, option like `--coverage-console` to dump coverage to console would be useful. Will handle this one, once i have  more time

title: Empty radio buttons not send (Yii2)
body: I was testing a radio button, specifically for it being selected or not (if not getting a validation error). The problem is that the data of a unselected radiobutton was not to be found in the POST. This is behavior by default in ie. by Chrome. Yii2 fixes this by inserting a hidden input like this: ```html Gezocht Aangeboden ``` Unfortunately, Codeception does not do a post of the Item[type] which breaks my software logic. In the browser it works fine.

title: https://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=1723
body:
When we do 

 $i->fillField("ADA (Online)");

The left parenthesis is "eaten" by the Firefox-dependent code in Selenium server.  Thus the value actually entered in the field is "ADA Online)".  And, the test fails.  

I can see that the correct value is being passed to Selenium, but it does not get transferred to the input element.  This is a know bug in the Firefox-dependent JS code.  See https://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=1723

I do realize that this is a Selenium issue, but I was hoping that you guys might be able to nudge them a bit.  

Thank you very much.
